verbs.description: tavernize (third-person singular simple present tavernizes, present participle tavernizing, simple past and past participle tavernized)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To frequent taverns; to go out drinking in taverns.
examples: Samuel certainly was no saint, and seems to have been a perfect giant in tavernizing and junketing generally  […]

entries.meaning: (transitive) To turn into a tavern, or adapt to the needs of taverns.
examples: In blithely demanding that America tavernize itself, the king ultimately sowed the seeds of his own doom. Taverns would come to serve the resistance more than they served the Crown  […]
